]","reasoning":"We need to extract characters. Paragraph text: "– Рассказывайте! Рассказывайте ещё! – заво­пили коротышки хором, увидев, что Знайка остановился." We have "Знайка" which is a character (from Russian children's literature). Identify as person? It's a nickname for a boy, a known character. We have "коротышки" - plural noun meaning "shorties", not specific characters. So we extract Знайка.

Canonical name: Should be normalized nominative "Знайка". Aliases: maybe we have none else in this text. No other forms. Gender: In original, Знайка is male. But we need evidence from text? It doesn't specify gender. But we know from literature but maybe not in evidence. The instruction says use gender if supported by evidence; otherwise unknown. The text doesn't indicate gender, just name. So we should set gender unknown.

Description: Must be 1-3 sentences, grounded in evidence. We can say: "Знайка – персонаж, который остановился, когда коротышки стали вопить о том, чтобы ему рассказали." Must be based on text: it says "увидев, что Знайка остановился." So description: "Знайка – персонаж, который остановился, когда коротышки просили его рассказывать." Good.

Return array with one object.

Ensure no extra fields.

Output JSON array.
